summary: This document consists of Bureau of Prisons count sheets, inmate rosters, and official count slips from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 10, 2019. It records inmate counts, assignments, and includes a suicide watch notation. The documents are routine prison administrative records.

events.title: Daily Prison Count and Assignments
events.description: Routine administrative count of inmates and assignment of operational categories (like Protective Segregation and Hospital) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center New York, NY
keyFacts: The document is dated August 10, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein died in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
It includes inmate rosters with assignments to Protective Segregation (PS) and Hospital (HOSP) units, with specific notations for 'SUICIDE OR' (suicide observation) next to several inmates.
The forms are standard Bureau of Prisons administrative records for inmate counts and assignments, showing routine prison operations.
The document does not mention Jeffrey Epstein by name, but the date and location are significant to the timeline of his death.
